item.description:
In a fantasy world, conflicts are merely a souvenir...
Wars are solved by powerful summoners fighting in a dedicated arena.
Each player incarnate a summoner that will try to defeat its opponents by unleashing powerful creatures to wreck havoc in the rival teams.
Summon creatures, gather magical rings and gain new spells while your opponents are doing the same.
Defeat creatures to increase your experience and improve your abilities.

During his turn, each player can choose two actions (possibly more later in the game) among five (movement, attack, search for a ring, summon, heal).
Moving will allow the player to explore new area of the game, increasing the amount of mana available and making ring search possible, or get closer to enemy's force.
Every aspect of the game is solved with dice (except for summoning creatures).
A player win when he annihilate all the other summoners.

This is a skirmish game blending strategy and chance, with a strong fantasy theme.

item.description:
Really close to happy families or games of trades, the goal is to collect a complete set of cards.

the theme of the game is first aid and families are related to to it (hazardous Products, first aid kit, holiday hazards, ect..)

after asking for a card, you need to answer the question on the card to win it.

The first player to collect a complete set win the game.

Dept. 13 is a game in which players use the Steel and Glory System to battle the creatures created by Occult Nazi Forces. Dept. 13 is a secret government agency dedicated to fighting supernatural forces. The game includes super spies (who are identified only by one letter initials), Nazi zombies, ghouls, mad scientists, and themes of occult horror. As with the other games in the S&G system, the battles are very quick and can be fought one-on-one or with players each controlling large groups. Each character has several unique stats, including their fighting ability, and the cost to hire them as a mercenary into your fighting force.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.

Cave Girl takes the S&G combat system to prehistoric times. In this game, a cave girl named Sharr must compete for her existence with dinosaurs. each character in the game comes with several cards designating their fighting abilities which can be used in battle. There are several scenarios included with the game.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.

name.value: NHL Big League Manager: Junior Edition

item.description:
Among the new features: player cards featuring NHL teams which allow Junior GM's to earn extra points by matching three or five of a kind ( from the same team). This game was also where we first developed the simplified scoring system which we liked so much, we used it for the Platinum Edition. 
Junior General Managers draft players, makes trades and can even grab a free agent from rival General Manager. Finally, the perfect board game for young hockey fans!

The object of the game is to build the strongest team of players best able to win hockey games all while balancing the difficult task of being a general manager. Your team is then pitted against your opponents. The winner of 5 games wins the game.

NHL Breakaway is a new and exciting action packed 2 player strategy card game. You and your opponent draw from the deck of cards placed between you. When you go to draw cards from the pile, you will draw Player Cards (they represent the players on your team), Instant Replay Cards (intangibles which
may momentarily affect a player or team’s performance) or Slapshot Cards (cards that have a more permanent effect on your team and the overall game).
With the help of your Player Cards and your other cards, try to win Possession of the puck during the face-off and then to go on the Attack to score more goals than your opponent over the course of 3 periods of play.

Progressive game with a favourite theme, where children help baby animals find their parents in a jungle with look-alike paths riddled with obstacles. 
Games begins with the closed board. Players roll 2 dice (number die and color die) and move on the board, open the tokens if it match with color die until they are able to go through the whole jungle and bring the lost baby animals safely to their mothers!

Contents:

 1 colourful game board 
 2 big foam dice, 
 35 tokens, 
 6 large wooden markers

item.description:
Your best friends are getting married, you are going to a family party, you are organising a friends weekend... And what if you spiced things up a bit by getting all these partygoers to kill each other?

The organiser gives everyone an assignment and a target amongst the attendees and gets ready to count the dead... As soon as a killer has accomplished his mission, he takes the assignment and the target of the dead person for himself. At the end of the game, the best serial killer and the last man standing will be rewarded!

The goal of Killer Party is to be the one person to succeed in the hunt, but all the others are trying to stab you in the back...

item.description:
The players are gnomes in the employ of a troll on a burger restaurant. The troll told them: "One of you will be fired at the end of the day; the one with worst cash!". The troll will take the customer’s orders and he hope the gnomes make their work fast, very fast; because if they delay an order, the customer (another troll, usually!) will get angry and leave the restaurant without paying.

GAME COMPONENTS

15 order cards
95 product cards
12 counters: 3 green, 3 blue, 3 yellow and 3 red
Rules

GAME PLAY

"Trollburger" is a 2-player card game. At the start of the turn, the starting player turn over the top deck card and show the number on it.

If that number is equal or higher thant the number of order cards on table, another order card is drawn and placed on the table.

Then the starting player choose to perform one of 4 actions on his turn. He can make that action as many times as the number shown at the start of the turn:

-Take cards from the product deck
 -Search a card from the product deck
 -Discard cards from the hand
 -Place products on the table to build a burger

Then, he can choose to deliver a burger to the customers. The player can deliver an incomplete burger, in the hope that the customer does not realize.

Next, the other player takes his turn, using the same number; 
and at last he becomes the starting player for the next turn.

If at any time, a 5th order has to be added on tha table, the older order on table is discarded (and any player who was working on it, loses his product cards).

GOAL

When a player devilers an order he takes that order card. 
The game ends if 4 orders are discarded or the last order card is drawn.
At the end of the game, each player add the victory points of his order cards. The player with more victory points is the winner.

(Here you can find all the files to print & play your own Trollburger).


Los jugadores son gnomos que trabajan para un troll en una hamburgueseria. El troll les ha comunicado que uno de ellos sera despedido al final del dia; aquel que aporte menos al negocio. El troll es el encargado de coger los pedidos de los clientes y espera que los gnomos hagan su trabajo rapido, muy rapido; pues si se retrasan en entregar un pedido, el cliente (normalmente otro troll!!) se va a enfadar y se ira del restaurante si haber consumido.

COMPONENTES DEL JUEGO

15 cartas de pedidos
95 cartas de productos
12 contadores: 3 verdes, 3 azules, 3 amarillos y 3 rojos
Reglas

EL JUEGO

"Trollburger" es un juego de cartas para 2 jugadores. Al principio del turno, el jugador inicial gira la carta superior de la baraja y muestra el número que aparece en ella.

Si ese numero es igual o mayor que el numero de cartas de pedidos en la mesa, aparece una nueva carta de pedido y se añade al centro de la mesa.

Después el jugador inicial elige cual de 4 posibles acciones quiere realizar en su turno. Podra hacer esa accion tantas veces como el numero que se ha mostrado al principio del turno:

-Coger cartas de la baraja de productos
 -Buscar una carta en la baraja de productos
 -Descartar cartas de la mano
 -Colocar productos en la mesa para elaborar una hamburguesa

Despues, puede elegir entregar una hamburguesa a los clientes. El jugador puede entregar una hamburguesa que no este acabada, con la esperanza de que el cliente no se de cuenta.

Acto seguido, el otro jugador realiza su turno, usando el mismo numero; y al final se convierte en el jugador inicial para el siguiente turno.

Si en algun momento, se debe anadir un 5º pedido a la mesa, el pedido mas antiguo que hubiera en la mesa se descarta (y cualquier jugador que estuviera elaborando ese bocata, pierde los productos que tuviera en la mesa).

OBJETIVO

Cuando un jugador entrega un pedido se queda esa carta de pedido.
El juego finaliza si 4 pedidos se han descartado o si se muestra el ultimo pedido del mazo.
Al final de la partida, cada jugador suma los puntos de victoria de sus cartas de pedidos. El jugador con mas puntos de victoria es el ganador.

(Aqui puedes encontrar todos los archivos necesarios para imprimir y jugar a tu propio Trollburger)

item.description:
String Railway: Transport is a follow-up game to String Railway, a train game in which the play area is created by placing varying lengths of colored string representing different types of terrain. The board is initially seeded with all the stations (unlike in String Railway) placed randomly inside the boundary string and filled with two goods cubes.

Each turn, players must place one string that connects stations. Then players have a number of action points to use. Players start with a 3 AP locomotive, and can upgrade to better locomotives that provide up to 6 AP per turn. Action points are used to moving goods cubes (1 AP to move from station to station). If a cube reaches a station of the same colour as the cube itself, the cube is then scored.

White cubes are special long distance cubes. Players have mission cards that show three stations in particular order. In order to fulfill the mission, the player must move a long-distance cube through the stations in right order. The reward depends on how many stations player moves the cube through. Unfulfilled mission is worth -2. Moving the cube through one station gets rid of the penalty. Two stations gets rid of the penalty and gives the player the white cube, which is scored as a wild cube. Three stations scores 5 points on top of that.

After five rounds, the cubes are scored. Each set of five cubes of different colours is worth 15 points, 4-cube sets are 10 points, 3-cube sets are 6 points, 2-cube sets are 3 points and remaining single cube sets give 1 point each. White wild cubes can be very useful at this point. Unfulfilled missions are -2 points, while perfectly fulfilled missions are +5 points.

In addition of moving cubes, action points can be used for upgrading locomotives and replenishing goods cubes. Collected goods cubes can be discarded to gain AP. Players can also draw new mission cards and each player has a personal station they can place on board at some point in game.

String Railway: Transport, with a playing time of approx. 15 minutes per player, differs from the original game by adding cargo delivery and removing the values of stations. Transport is an individual game, not an expansion. The games are not compatible: you can't play String Railway with the components of Transport (the stations are different and there's no river).

item.description:
Freedom is a two-player abstract strategy board game invented by Veljko Cirovic and Nebojsa Sankovic in 2010. It is played with black and white stones on a square board. The game is related to Go-Moku and Slimetrail. It can be played with a Go set or with pen and paper.

Rules:

Board: Freedom is played on a 10×10 square board. Beginners can try the game on a 8×8 board. Other board sizes may be also used.

Objective: The objective of Freedom is to have more "live" stones at the end of the game, than your opponent. A stone is considered to be "live" if it is a part of some horizontal, vertical or diagonal row of exactly 4 stones of the same color.

Play: A game begins with an empty board. Each player has an allocated color: White and Black. White plays first, putting one white stone anywhere on the board. After this move players take turns placing their stones on empty cells adjacent to the last opponent's stone. If all cells adjacent to the last opponent's stone are occupied then the player gets the right ("freedom") to place his stone on any empty cell of the board. The game ends when the board is filled with stones. The last player has the right to pass on his last turn (and leave the last cell empty) if placing his stone reduces his score.

item.description:
Super GÅ‚owa is a Polish crossword game, not unlike Scrabble, in which words are formed on the board with the use of tiles; these words are awarded points with a special bonus system. The difficulty and intellectual level of this game depends on the players.

This game is targeted at both adults, who will find it an interesting way of spending their free time with their friends and families, and children, for whom it will be both a fun game and a learning opportunity. This game aids the development of intelligence, vocabulary and spelling skills.

Components:
- four wooden tile holders
- one thick cardboard board
- 126 cardboard square letter tiles (Polish characters included)
- 2 blank tiles

item.description:
Colgate Crusaders is a children's roll and move game published by the company Colgate Palmolive Ltd. in 1983. It was not available for general purchase in stores but rather was obtainable by sending off for it to the company.

The game is a promotional piece designed to advertise the benefits of Colgate toothpaste and encourage good dental hygiene amongst children. It encourages regular brushing and general use of Colgate products and warns against the dangers of too much sugar, fizzy drinks, etc.

The game is set in the fictional Molar System where the players (each playing as one of the game's heroes; Captain Colgate, Blue Minty Kid, Flick Flouride and Mike Molar) are trying to protect the system by keeping it clear of evil villains. They are constantly on patrol battling against the forces of darkness - Sugary Sam, Sweetie Pie, the Gumboot Boys and the Enamel Animal with his servants the Plaque Monsters.

The aim of the game is to be the first to capture 3 Plaque Monsters and return them to your space ship.

item.description:
Flossie Carrington had it all - she was young and beautiful, she was the heiress to an American steel empire, and she was married to a handsome ex-Guards officer. But last Thursday, the nation was shocked by the discovery of her body, stuffed under the seat of a first-class compartment on the Plymouth Express. She had been stabbed to death and her fabulously expensive jewels were stolen.

Flossie's father promptly called in Hercule Poirot to investigate. And now he has summoned all those concerned with the case to reveal what really happened that fateful afternoon. One - or more - of you around this table is a murderer. And your task is to discover who that is.

This is the new edition of A First Class Murder, with a new plot and new characters, based on a couple of Agatha Christie's mysteries.

Ever dreamt about being a yakitori chef? Serving up meat and veg skewered, Japanese-style, onto sticks? Grilling on the open flames and hot coals while the sweat drips down the back of your neck and the customers get more and more merry? No? Well now’s your chance to give it a go anyway. Maybe playing “Yakitori” will be the first step on a life changing career change!

Yakitori is a card game for 2-4 players. The aim of the game is to gather the ingredients to put together sticks of meat and veg before cooking them and serving them up to customers. Each customer wants something different – from quail eggs to beef, from asparagus to chicken, carefully seasoned with salt or sweet dark “tare” sauce.

A set collecting game. Cards are traded noisily until one player has at least five of one team. The first to do so cries "Piktee" and scores 50 points and claims the Free Kick card, and a new deal starts (the Free Kick card has no purpose at all so I do not know why it was included in the game).
If a player dares, he may not call out his 5 card team but he can wait to get a six card team. If he is still the first to call "Piktee" he will score double points but, of course, by waiting, someone else might call a team before him and he will not score.
The Penalty card is exactly that, a penalty card. If you are caught with it in your hand when "Piktee" is called, you lose 25 points.
The first player to score 500 points after several deals, wins.

An arithmetically paired fishing game with the Decktet.

In the Eastern Deserts, the jackrabbits are regarded as a pest and a delicacy. Lesser known is that between eating (and being eaten) they while away their time with a simple fishing game.

As a fishing game, the goal of the game is to capture cards. Each player will play two cards every turn, capturing cards using either the sum or difference of the played cards. The players that captures the most cards scores points for the round. The first player to reach twenty-two points wins the game and is granted the privilege to be the first bunny out for dinner.

The game is a reinvention of the classic Moroccan fishing game Ronda. Aside from using the Decktet instead of the Latin Deck, the game is also played with two cards at a time and bonuses are given for suit combinations played.

item.description:
A feeding frenzy for two bunnies.

This is a simple fishing game of capturing cards off the tableau. The game starts with an 8x3 grid of cards face up on the table. After splitting the undealt cards (using a split the pie mechanism) the players capture cards by playing one or more cards whose rank adds up equal or higher than the card being captured. Each of the capturing cards must share a suit with the card being taken. After the tableau is cleared, the players add up the values of their captured cards to determine the winner.

Even though the game was designed as a light game, it is almost completely a perfect information game. The only moment where there is not perfect information is when the players determine the split of the hand -- and even then they can figure out which cards the opponent is splitting. As such it could be played as a very memory heavy, intense, spatial game.

The game was inspired by the designer's pet rabbit who is by far the most enthusiastic and fastest eating bunny the designer has ever seen. The girl has no problems yanking food right out of her partner's mouth, but is readily aggrieved if she does not get her fair share of the produce.

item.description:
The Ides of March is a small game about the assassination of Julius Caesar. The premise is that Mark Anthony appears on the scene armed with a sword, albeit some distance from the scene. He has to either kill all the conspirators or get Caesar off the map before he is killed. Since he has a sword, he does considerably more damage with his attacks than the conspirators (armed with daggers) can manage.

The game contains rules, combat results table, map, and 10 counters, all printed on a single sheet of paper.

First in a series of Hex and Counter war games at Battalion level covering the Napoleonic Era.

Austerlitz is fought over a number of A3 boards (3 for Austerlitz). Counters represent the major units of Infantry,Cavalry, and Artillery units that fought the battle.

Movement is conducted at both Grand Tactical Level ( Some units may move more than others) and Tactical Level depending on the Battle fought. Here, movement is dealt at the Tactical Level only with four phases being Move,Fire,Melee,and Resolution.The Grand Tactical Level is merely the turn record of the battle which lasts 24 turns from 0600 hours to 1800 hours.

Battles are fought at both a Fire and Melee stage, Fire being those units firing which are in range of the enemy by using a dice + fire add on factors - Defensive attributes to achieve a final score. If the score is equal or greater the the units vulnerability score (7), units are placed face down and rendered non-operational.

In the melee stage, those units which did not fire in the Fire tactical stage may now battle and use one dice + Melee add on factor to achieve a final score. If the final score is greater than 6 against a non-operational unit, then that unit is destroyed.

Victory is decided by the player with the most units left after 24 turns.

From the rules:
Welcome to the world of the furtive whitetail buck! Considered by veteran hunters to be one of the most challenging big game species on our continent, he is an amazingly adaptable animal, inhabiting regions from the fringes of our cities to remote wilderness.

Join fellow hunters in the stimulating, educational, sometimes frustrating, but always exciting chase as the whitetail seeks to elude you on his own turf.

WORLD RECORD BUCK is more than just a great game. It is a fine training tool for the young or future hunter, and serves as a reminder to us 'old timers' as well as we prepare for the next season. This game will help you get it all together! And who knows? The taker of the next 'World Record Buck' just may be you!


 In this game, players play both a hunter and a deer, trying to stalk the deer belonging to other players while moving their own deer away from any hunters. First player to bag two deer win the game.

link.value: The Makers of World Record Buck

item.description:
A two-player game for the Decktet:

It is the last battle in the final campaign of a mad but brilliant general. Six companies of tired soldiers are all that stands between him and the advancing enemy. He doesn't realize it yet, but there is no way for him to win.

Fortunately, you are not playing the general in this game. Unfortunately, you're not the advancing army either.

Instead, you play a member of the general's staff. You were offered money by captains of a few of the remaining companies. Maneuver them off the field before the inevitable defeat, and they will pay you handsomely. So cue the fifes and drums! Jigger the retreat orders to put your cronies as far from danger as possible.

Of course, everybody else on the general's staff was bribed to put their cronies ahead of yours.

The game is played on a track, with the companies represented by six tokens corresponding to each of the Decktet suits. Each player starts with a secret goal card, telling them which units they want to have do well. Each turn, players draft from a pool of cards, moving the units that correspond to their card's suit a total distance corresponding to their card's rank.

In Regnum+Potestas+Gloria, a fledgling kingdom emerges from the chaos of Europe’s Dark Ages. As a great house in this kingdom, you must work with – and against – your fellow houses to bring stability, order, and progress to a struggling land.

You will use loyal Retainers from your court to secure your fiefs and gather Labor – one of the five types of Power you can earn and spend. As you develop and grow, you will find it advantageous to grant land to Monks, Knights, and Merchants, each of whom earns you a different type of Power. This also frees up Retainers so they can be used to take more actions on the game’s various boards.

These boards reflect the kingdom’s customs – its political, religious, economic, and feudal structures. Each custom offers the players a unique set of actions, and some include Offices - positions of influence that grant their holders bonus Power as well as access to exclusive actions. Just as important, each custom dictates the types of Power valued by society; houses that produce the right kinds of Power will gain more Glory, and will ultimately win the game.

In addition to paying for actions, Power can be used to change the customs themselves, opening up new actions and offices, and altering the types of Power that will lead to victory. Players must therefore either adapt to new customs, or work to ensure that the existing customs remain in place. As you navigate your way to greatness and victory, you will find yourself arranging marriages, earning titles, erecting grand structures, and fighting alongside your fellow Houses as foreign nations invade the kingdom, but in the end only one house will be celebrated in the history books. That house must, by rights, be yours…

item.description: A simple trivia game for 2-12 players. Those have to answer questions of 4 different topics: "Tales and Legends", "Sports and Games", "Nature and Environment" and "General". If the answer is right the players token goes one step forward on the board. The player first reaching the finish line wins the game.

name.value: Défis Nature: À la rencontre des primates
Défis Nature: Dans le sillage des animaux marins
Défis Nature: Dans les airs avec les Oiseaux
Défis Nature: Sur la piste des carnivores
Défis Nature: Sur les traces des reptiles

item.description:
Défis Nature is a quick and educational nature themed card game.

The goal is to hold all the cards of the game.
for shorter games, players can choose a playing time and the winner is the player with the most cards in hands at the end.

Each card shows an animal with some infos and four or five caracteristics (depending of the edition).
The first player choose a caracteristic (for exemple "speed") and lays a card, in turn each player lays a card and the player with the highest value in this caracteristic win all the cards of this turn and starts a new one.

the Cards are classified in 4 categories, from "safe" to "critically endangered" species.
The 3 "in danger" categories allow to change the choosen caracteristic of the turn (in order of priority)

item.description:
Kyogami is a simple roll and move game, primarily educational.
The game mechanism is deliberately simple and the game focuses on the Kyoto Protocol.

Players are manufacturers, they manage and buy factories, trying to reduce their carbon emission levels and they trade some Carbon "quotas".

Darn! is an abstract, tactical, card playing, dice rolling board game taking place on three different areas.
On the playing board players move their pawns from field to field, try to collect tokens and to be the first to enter the goal field.
The dice pool contains a number of dice with positive and negative numbers. Players may choose dice from the dice pool when making moves.
Cards are played to perform moves, manipulate the dice or modify the way the dice are used.

Players watch a game of American football on TV, and use cards to try to score points based on the plays made in the actual game.

[i]From the rule card:[/i]
Football Fanatic is an interactive football party that is played by two or more players. The limit to the number of players depends on availability of cards. There are 39 cards in the standard football Fanatic game allowing for 39 players. Get more cards for more players.

Ultimate Warriorz is a revamped version of Mad Arena from the same designer, with enhanced and revised components and rules.

In the game, each player picks one of the included characters, then either individually or in teams they fight it out in the small arena by carefully managing their action cards. After each player picks an action card in secret, players act in order of initiative, counting down from eight to seven to six, etc., with a player calling out their action when their initiative number is called. (In the event of a tie, you refer to values on the individuals cards to see who acts first.) Faster characters tend to be weaker, but ideally they can get their best shots in first, with dice being rolled to determine the results of various attacks.

Each character card is unique with four characteristics important for attacks — melee attack, ranged attack, speed, initiative — and each character has two unique actions to inflict on others!

item.description:
The game was developed with the aid of stock exchange brokers. The target audience are those people who want to have an easy introduction on the way the stock exchange works.

The aim of the game is to make your starting capital grow by buying stocks and gold. The worth of the stock fluctuates throughout the game, and the aim is to buy/sell stock at the most opportune time.
Rules also include Tender offers and Holdings.

Winner is the player with the highest worth of stock and gold.

A card game containing 6 different welsh characters broken up into a head, a torso, and feet. Players attempt for form a complete character, and then empty their hands except for the crown card (which is unique in the deck). Most cards in the deck allow you to swap or steal body parts from other players, creating mixed-up characters as the game proceeds.

[i]From the Rules:[/i]
Each player tries to form a BODY consisting of three cards - HEAD, TORSO and FEET - either of different suits (good) or the same suit (best). In order to win, a player must form a BODY and get rid of all the cards in their hand, going out of play with only body parts in front of them with at least one each of a HEAD, TORSO and FEET and the KROWN card, with no other cards in their hand.

[i]From the Box:[/i]
Whats Dwyn?
A game with lots of card swapping. A six suited poker deck divided into three colors, red, black and green with figures drawn from welsh history and popular culture. A fun new artwork by Simon Frennan and Christopher Sperandio. The result of an artists residency as part of the may-you-live-in-interesting-times festival of creative technology. The residency is findancially supported by Cywaith Cymru. Get rules for new games, and play an online version, just go to chapter.org or kartoonkings.com/dwyn.

Beth yw Dwyn?
Gem fywiog yn llawn o gyfnewid cardiau. Pecyn o gardiau mewn chew siwt wedi'u rhannu'n dri lliw, coch, du a gwyrdd, ynghyd a ffigyrau o hanes a diwylliant poblogiadd cymru. Gwaith celfyddydol hwyliog, newydd gan Simon Grennan a Christopher Sperandio. Canlyniad cyfnod preswyl yng MAY YOU LIVE IN INTERESTING TIMES, gyl technoleg greadigol caerdydd, a drefnwyd gan chapter a bloc. Carfwyd cefnogaeth ariannol i'r cyfnod preswyl gan cywaith cymru. I weld rheolau'r gem, ac i chwarae fersiwn ar-lien, ewch i chapter.org neu kartoonkings.com/dwyn.

before each round, players take a team token and keep it hidden.
players can be distributed randomly in 2 or 3 teams, without knowing who are their team mates

During the rounds players fight each other using bananas cards to inflict damages. some other cards have special power like "healing", "counter" or "identification" (reveal the team token of the taget player).
When a player takes 110 damages, he is dead for the round and reveal his team token.
The round ends when the last player of a team is eliminated.
Players earns points depending of their teams and if they are alive or not.
Then another round begin...

The player with the highest score at the end win the game.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

A Monopoly style game featuring the Scheels sporting goods company.

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description:
Let's Rodeo is a game for people to enjoy the sport of rodeo anyplace, anytime. This game is designed to show how one rodeos, starting from the amateur right up to the pro circuit and through to the finals.

Players roll a die and move around the game board, which consists of two circuits, amateur and pro. All players start by moving around the amateur circuit. Players enter rodeos by landing on a rodeo square and paying the entry fee. A card is then drawn which gives the player's result in the rodeo and money is awarded. Each rodeo can be entered multiple times. There are places on the board where players must pay money and some where broke players can earn money. Filling a "permit" (earning a set amount of money) is necessary to move into the pro circuit.

Once in the pro circuit each player must enter and place in each of the 8 pro rodeos. Each rodeo can only be entered once. Once any player has completed all 8 pro rodeos the finals begin. Any players still on the amateur circuit are eliminated. All players on the pro circuit roll dice to find out their standings in the final events. Winnings in the finals are added to money earned in the pro circuit and the winner is the player with the most money.

Counter is a miniature game that lets you assemble a squad of troops that meets your requirements and then pit them against your opponents in real time.
Played in 30 second rounds, players race their miniatures over the contested hot-spots of the battle field while targeting and throwing out cover fire as best they can.

But speed and reflex must be tempered with strategy and patience.
Expend more resources than your opponents and they will get the drop on you.

But perhaps your squad has an ace or two up it's sleeve?
Did you bring more gunners than your opponent to likely win any fire fight? Or perhaps you opted to bring Heavies to devastate the battlefield and control the field of play? Or maybe you decided to unleash the kind of tactics and tricks that only your Ops can bring to a squad?

In any case, the battle will be fast a vicious, and leave you with plenty to consider and tinker with before the next battle begins.

---

Game play for Counter consists of 30 second rounds of frantic live action troop maneuvers performed by all players simultaneously.
Strategy and nerve must be used to lay out your action chips on the zones marked out in the battle field, as their placement will allow for different actions to take place:
- place them down in a zone and you can then move a troop on top of them, provided you can get him there fast enough
- place your chip on top of another players chip to lay down cover fire, preventing an enemy entering that zone.
- use your chips to target the troops in a zone, then get your troops in range to finish them off.
- reserve your chips to build up your intuitive and get the drop on other combatants, firing before they do. 
All of these actions and more take place fluidly, and then the action resolves in a snap when the timer chimes, then in a flash it continues on in subsequent rounds until the battle field is secured or left devastated.

The dynamic real time action system along with team construction and the various orders and tactics that players can field with Op cards ensures every game of Counter will demand thought and instinct of a high caliber from all players.

Zanshin is a fast-paced bluff-based game about samurai fencing inspired by kendo and "Book of Five Rings". This game is my attempt to focus gameplay on "learn your opponent" rather than "learn in-game tactics".
Each player has same hand of skill, bluff and attack cards and five random Strike cards. Each round player try to spend less skill cards than his opponent in order to get advantage or catch an opponent on opposite strike. Players play their skill and bluff cards face down to form their intention for current round, than reacts on opponent's strikes and than ether evade or counterattack.
Three player variant Twofaced Dragon allows player to recreate 2vs1 fight. This variant keeps almost all mechanic from main rules and all players starts with same sets of cards, so wining this fight is very thought challenge for Dragon. I tired to make this variant as close to real situations in kenjutsu as possible. There is no artificial benefits or constrains and every mechanic change justified by real aspect of that kind of fights.

My Happy Farm is a game in which players strive to become the best farmer.

All players have their own farm with four nice animals. They feed those cuties. Animals which are fed well fill their stomachs with tasty food, grow and become longer and longer, even reaching unnatural lengths. The longer your animal, the better a farmer you are. The owner of the longest animal receives bonus points. Animals which aren't fed even one time lose their weight, take offense, and leave their bad master. Moreover, they will take some victory points from the bad master to punish him, so players have to be good and careful farmers and feed their animals well to create Their Own Happy Farm.

name.value: Observation Competition: Letters L and M

item.description: Party game. Up to 12 guests are given the same picture and it is suggested that they might try to find up to 60 objects in the picture that begin with a D. The one who makes the longest list (of correct answers, of course) wins.

Party game. 15 pictures (all different) are placed round the room before the party starts. When guests arrive, they are encouraged to look at the pictures at some time during the party. The picture should suggest a well-known item to them. The one who gets the most right answers after an agreed time, wins.

Party game for up to 20 players. They have to then complete their telegram.
Cards are scattered round the room where most guests will congregate. Each player gets a different Number 1 card. On the bottom right corner there will be another word and that is the next card they must find. And so on until they have found the 12 words that complete their telegram. The first to do so, wins.

Party game for up to 52 guests.
On arrival, guests are given a card that will tell them their personality for the evening. They are then told to circulate and whilst talking to people, they can ask if they are a certain personality. If the answer is no, then nothing happens, but if the answer is yes, then the person you asked will tell you of the next personality you need to find.
First to collect all 8 personalities wins.

Maneuver your kings and knights to the castle wall, but watch out as your opponent uses air blasters to knock your players off the board. The first player to get two of their pieces to the castle wall is the winner. Kings and knights can only move in a certain direction, so be sure to strategize before moving so as not to wander too close to your opponents air catapault.

The gameplay in Abtei der Rätsel is inspired by "The Name of the Rose", but plays much like a variant of Hangman. One card is chosen with a word - either a 10 character word (with the easy cards) or a 5-9 character word with blank spaces distributed throughout (with the difficult cards). The card is placed in a plastic bookshelf, which allows each of the letters (or spaces) in the word to be viewed individually.

Players then send their monks and novices to collect clues; six clues may be easily obtained from books found around the monastery, but the other four can only be viewed within the locked laboratory. The first player to correctly determine the word wins.

This game is a redevelopment of Abtei der wandernden BÃ¼cher in a more affordable edition.

item.description:
Four armies of alien micro-monstrosities clash in a challenge to the last jump!

In Micro Monsters, four races of horribly cute aliens – Autogators, Bigbears, Finbacks, and Turboturtles – face off, with each race wanting to close the rival monsters' dimensional gates. Using dexterity-based game play similar to that in MicroMutants and X-Bugs – and more commonly seen in Tiddly Winks – players in Micro Monsters "shoot" their monster tokens across the playing area by pressing on one edge of them with a "monster shooter" to send them flying. Land on an opponent, even with the tiniest bit of your monster, and you capture that opponent's token, removing it from play. Land on an opponent's gate, on the other hand, and you remove one of that opponent's energy tokens; take an opponent's final token and she must flip her gate to the damaged side. Land on a damaged gate, and that opponent is out of the game!

At the start of a player's turn, that player first rolls a die. If he rolls a monster, he takes his normal turn; if he rolls his race's special symbol, he uses his special alien power:


 Autogators move two separate monsters on the same turn.
 Bigbears move one monster, then place a trap on an opponent's monster to immobilize it until the next Bigbears turn.
 Finbacks move the same monster twice on the same turn.
 Turboturtles move one monster, then place a shield on it that prevents it from being captured until that player's next turn.


The last player to have an open gate – whether damaged or not – wins!

item.description:
Les càcous de Marseille is a french roll & move game around the town of Marseille (a high place of regional specificities) it's culture and history in the humorous way.

Players move on the board then answer questions and make imitations to move ahead.
the subjects are the town, the language, the history and the soccer club (of course !)

Player who first arrives in the Vélodrome stadium win the game.

Dwarf King's Hold: Green Menace is a two-player game in which one player controls the vicious and brutal Orcs, and the other player controls the Noble Elves who oppose them. The game is set in the echoing tunnels of an ancient Dwarf Hold in which are entombed many of the ancestral relics of the Elves, won in battle between their ancestors and those of the Dwarfs. The Elves are trying to recover these artifacts; the Orcs are simply out for gold and a good fight!

The game includes six new scenarios, each of which uses the tiles provided with the game to create a different board. In each scenario you control a number of miniatures representing your warriors, which you move across the board and use to fight your opponent's miniatures to achieve the scenario's objective. The variable nature of the scenarios means that each poses different challenges for both sides.

Dwarf King's Hold: Green Menace includes 29 plastic figures: six Orc Ax Warriors, two Orc Greatax warriors, ten Elf Spearmen, ten Elf Bowmen and one sabre-toothed pussy cat.

Dwarf King's Hold: Green Menace is a complete, stand-alone game that includes everything you need to play.

Integrates with:

 Dwarf King's Hold: Dead Rising

Designers Note:

Have found a potentially interested publisher, and several changes to the design have been made. I'm very pleased with them, but this may mean that the description here will change. - Alex

SEVEN WEEKS is a 2 to 3 player Euro-style war game that aims to recreate the maneuvering, bloodshed, and events of the Austro-Prussian War of 1866 in the German and Bohemian theaters. (The Italian front is also represented as an influence upon forces available and overall morale.)

Players represent the Prussians and their North German allies, the Bavarian and Federal German forces (including Baden, Hesse Darmstadt, Nassau, and Wurttemburg amongst others) , and the Habsburgs (who also control the Saxons, Hanoverians, and Kurhessen/Hesse-Kassel forces). The Bavarian and Habsburg forces must work together to stop the Prussians from achieving the historical victory - a crushing blow for the Habsburgs, a defeat for independent states in Germany, and the beginning of a long era of Prussian hegemony over German affairs.

The game utilizes hand management and card driven mechanics. The map is a traditional hex map, depicting major population centers, fortresses, and rail lines. The combat system uses a system of "tactical cards" and battlefield deployment, implementing some fresh ideas intended to represent the player's role as the commander in chief of a military establishment and the necessity of relying upon the battlefield doctrine practiced by his/her forces. Prussian forces, for example, heavily rely upon open order formation and "Schnellfeuer" technique, while the Habsburgs are fond of the "Stosstaktik" approach and rely upon a superior artillery arm. The game is completely diceless.

The aim is to produce an exciting wargame that can easily be played within two hours. The game is currently in playtesting, and hoping for a "Sooner than Later" publication date as we look for a publisher.

Each player starts with 25 "ovni's" in his own color, 4 blue "ovni's" and 1 white "ovni".

The players take turns placing "ovni's", which are gears, on the board, thus creating a chain of gears. The gears must placed so that the gears can still turn.

A player can block an opponent's chain by placing a pirate (blue "ovni") at the end of his chain.

The player that can make the opponent's gear turn wins.

A game of wheeling 'n' dealing - ducking 'n' diving - making or breaking!

Players move their character around the board, buying and gambling until there is only one player left with any money.

This is a roll-and-move game, where each space is either a gamble for gain or a penalty space.

This is a trivia game about the German city of Munich.

Players roll a die, move around the trails on the board across Munich (a satelite photo) and answer questions about the state. The first one to make it back to the starting space after collecting 8 cards from the different Bavarian regions and answering a final question correctly wins.

link.value: Stadt Buch Verlag Wolfgang Giesche München

item.description:
Plutonian Poker is a set collection game for 2-6 players that uses Looney Pyramids. Players claim pyramids from a shared pool, building scoring combinations with their claimed pyramids. The twist is that you are not allowed to rearrange your claims once you've made them, making the more complicated and valuable sets riskier to achieve.

Rules here: http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Plutonian_Poker

item.description:
Pyrinoes is a game for two players that combines two game systems: double-six dominoes and Looney Pyramids. Players begin the game with a supply of dominoes and two colors of pyramids. Players take turns adding pieces from their supply to the chain of played pieces, either by placing dominoes or by creating a "pyrino" out of pyramids. When one person runs out of pieces, the round ends, and the winner scores points. Subsequent rounds are played until one player has earned 100 points. Pyrinoes adds strategic depth to classic Dominoes by giving the players the ability to create a desired piece, but at the risk of revealing critical information to the opponent.

Rules here: http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Pyrinoes

item.description:
Let's Play Scotland Yard!

Which player will have the roll of the elusive Mister X? One player will function as Mister X, with the other players being detectives searching for him throughout Switzerland.

The starting station cards are shuffled and everyone draws one to determine where they will start the game. Every move is either by bus, train, or airplane. Mister X moves first and writes his move in his travel log, indicating what method of transportation he used but not where he moved. Then, each detective makes their move, cooperating with the other detectives in an effort to close in on Mister X. Mister X only reveals where he is at certain points in the game, and the chase continues until one of the detectives moves to the place where Mister X is. In this case, the team of detectives has won the game. But, if Mister X makes 24 moves without being caught, he himself wins!

Thanks to some added features and a new map, this localized version modernizes Ravensburger's classic game Scotland Yard and transfers the manhunt from London to Switzerland.
Ski areas and boat routes help Mister X to escape...

Re-implements:

 Scotland Yard

item.description: This is a nature-themed Lotto game. One player is designated "caller" and every player is given a large 3x3 card featuring images of wildlife. The pictures are unique to the each card are not repeated, unlike traditional Lotto. The caller has a deck of smaller cards that have been shuffled and placed face down. One by one, the caller turns over the cards and announces the name of the animal or plant shown on the card. If someone has a match, he claims the card and places it on the corresponding art on his large card. The game is over when a player has completed all nine matches on his large card. That player is declared the winner.

item.description:
The tiniest of games I have seen, I think this one is smaller than Panzerpranks?

4 hexes one counter

The object is for the Germans to occupy the Rhineland just prior to WWII. A die must be provided by the players. The sequence is pretty simple, the German player attempts to enter the hexes of the Rhineland. Rolling on a chart to see if his move is successful. The French player does nothing. With a bad roll a French 75 goes off accidentally stopping the 
German Move. The German wins if he enters all hexes of the Rhineland, the French player wins if he does SOMETHING!

Tounge in cheek, simple effective rules, I do see that it needs a little errata though.

name.value: Flash Point: Met en voor elkaar door het vuur!

item.description:
The call comes in... "911, what is your emergency?" On the other end is a panicked response of "FIRE!" Moments later you don the protective suits that will keep you alive, gather your equipment and rush to the scene of a blazing inferno. The team has only seconds to assess the situation and devise a plan of attack – then you spring into action like the trained professionals that you are. You must face your fears, never give up, and above all else work as a team because the fire is raging, the building is threatening to collapse, and lives are in danger.

You must succeed. You are the brave men and women of fire rescue; people are depending on you. This is what you do every day.

Flash Point: Fire Rescue is a cooperative game of fire rescue.

There are two versions of game play in Flash Point, a basic game and expert game.
In both variants, players are attempting to rescue 7 of 10 victims from a raging building fire.
As the players attempt to rescue the victims, the fire spreads to other parts of the building, causing structural damage and possibly blocking off pathways through the building. Each turn a player may spend action points to try to extinguish fires, move through the building, move victims out of the building or perform various special actions such as moving emergency vehicles. If 4 victims perish in the blaze or the building collapses from taking too much structural damage, the players lose. Otherwise, the players win instantly when they rescue a 7th victim.

The expert variant included in the game adds thematic elements such as flash over, combustible materials, random setup, and variations on game difficulty from novice to heroic. The game includes a double sided board with two different building plans and several expansion maps are available.

item.description:
You’ve seen the sprinkler, you’ve even seen the lawn mower, but you have never seen anything like this. 
 You get a 40 second song clip during your turn. You dance as many items as you can. 
For the items other people guess correctly, you get one point. 
BUT HERE IS THE TWIST! You get rewarded points from others if your dancing is awesome. Everyone else has tokens and can reward your dancing awesomeness with up to three tokens per turn. 
This keeps people dancing and not just charading.


What comes in the box:
300 dance cards
Score pad
300 tokens
Audio CD with 40 songs

A Zombie strategy game for 3 or more players, where the person who survives the longest wins.

Each player controls 1 Human and 3 Zombies. Aim of the game is to be the last Human to survive the Zombie attack. Each player takes turns to run from the shuffling Zombies, then each takes turns to move their Zombies to try and corner and bite the other players' Humans. Humans generally move a fixed number of 6 speaces, whilst Zombies move according to a dice roll (1-6). Get bitten as a Human and you still have 5 turns - or until you get bitten again if sooner - until you become a Zombie yourself. Cards take it beyond a basic roll 'n' move, with positive (for yourself) and negative (for others) special effects.

There are various cards that can either help or hinder.

item.description:
A card game featuring lovely images of animals.Each player chooses a different animal, from the 8 listed on the Key Card.
Cards are dealt out and kept by each player in a face-down stack. In his turn, a player must turn over the top card. If it matches any other face-up card, both players with the now matching cards must call "Oosehe"?, and name the animal now revealed. The first to do so, claims the matching cards plus all the cards beneath it.
The rules are a little strange in that you are asked to call the name as listed on the Key Card but as this name is also on the cards, players could just read the card itself. Maybe Victorian children found these animals exotic and not instantly recognisable.
The name of the game is pronounced "Oose he?", as rhyming with the phrase "Whose He?"

A rare card game for the late Victorian era. For once, it is not a Snap, Happy Families or Old Maid variant.
The cards have a fair amount of text on them (see images), not just the naval illustration. I am assuming that cards are revealed and interaction takes place between the different kinds of vessels now on view. The Battleship can protect 'Simple cards' drawn against a Destroyer. The Cruiser is a 'Simple card' itself and needs the protection of the Battleship. And other ships have their 'rules', the Destroyer, the Merchantman and the Torpedo Boat. A Victorian boy must have been thrilled with this game, with its military links.
By the way, the odd title is intended to be pronounced 'Sea-Fight'.

"FQ3" is a board game that recreates the world of the car races. With a mixture of strategy, action, control of risk, and some touches of role, FQ3 represents a real way (and funny too), all that happens inside and outside of the tracks.

"FQ3" has 3 difficulty levels of rules to satisfy all kind of players;

- BASIC RULES: Aimed at casual and undemanding gamers.

- ADVANCED RULES: For fans of race games. These rules are more realistic, and involved all sorts of factors: such as types of tires, fuel loads, setting the car, kers, yellow flag, Safety Car, moral of drivers and injuries, etc.

- MANAGER MODE: Only for those who drink gasoline! In this game mode, in addition to the role of pilot, you will assume the role of team manager. You will manage the economy, hiring drivers, sponsors, engineers, desing the car and evolve it. The years pass and drivers will gain experience and they will improve their skills.

SUMMARY OF GAMEPLAY: The Friday of the GP, the player must decide the strategy (number of stops, tires, and fuel load).

On Saturday, will be held the pole position, it follows a mathematical operation involving various modifiers (skills of the pilot, car performance, fuel load, tires, moral, blunders, and a roll of 1d20).

The race takes place the Sunday.
The circuit is composed of squares. The cars will go moving by circuit as many squares as the speed (gear dependent) of your car.
When the cars reach the corners, the drivers must brake and accelerate. Brakes and accelerates with a d100. Drivers have an ability to Brake and Accelerate that used to take curves (higher or lower depending on driver).
These skills will be modified by the fuel load, tire types, and how close you decide to brake and accelerate.
The risk you take in the curves is important; you can take away your opponents, but be careful!, fail brake roll or acceleration roll will damage your car.

The game stands on four pillars:
The driver, the car, the pit stop mechanics, and the circuit.
Each of them has many different skills, qualities or details that make it different from the others.

This is a brief summary of how to play. There are many and funny rules, such as kers, spin, overtaking, blunders, drivers' virtues, drive's defects, safety car,etc.

name.value: Ninja: Legend of the Scorpion Clan

item.description:
A Strategy Game of Hidden Movement

The night is quiet, but somewhere in the darkness shadows are moving. A ninja and a double-crossing samurai sneak into the Lion Clan castle, intent on completing their dastardly tasks. Though alert, the Lion guards are as yet unaware that anything is amiss...

This tense standalone game pits Lion Clan samurai guards against a Scorpion Clan ninja and his traitor ally. As the ninja or the traitor, you will use hidden movement to sneak into the castle, eliminate guards, find your mission objective, and escape. As the guards, you will use your wits and superior numbers to thwart the sinister Scorpion.

In this exciting new game set in the world of Legend of the Five Rings, you must use your limited resources, powers of deduction, and a touch of guile to outthink and outmanoeuvre your opponent. Daring, planning, and a little luck will determine whether you triumph or meet your end on 3 feet of steel.

[Publisher blurb]

item.description:
LiberalOpoly follows the format of Parker Brothers Monopoly.

Instead of trading properties, as is the case of Monopoly, LiberalOpoly player's trade political favors in exchange for financial support from interest groups. Instead of Chance and Community Chest cards, LiberalOpoly features "Bushwacked" and "Meet the Press" Cards, which are an especially creative aspect of the game.

The cover image for LiberalOpoly portrays John Kerry as Mr. Monopoly, with cane in hand, popping out of the "O" in LiberalOpoly. It also features an intoxicated Ted Kennedy drunk on the lawn, John Edwards chasing an ambulance, Michael Moore eating cheeseburgers and Barbara Streisand flying over the Hollywood hills on a broom

Ranger Rick-opoly has all the fun of a traditional property game with some wild twists.
Go hiking and be a caretaker for your favorite animals in the Deep Green Wood. Raise the rent by collecting blocks of fresh CLEAN AIR and trade them in for a big PINE TREE! Learn fun facts on each animal deed... and MAKE CAMP and join Ranger Rick and his friends on a wonderful adventure.

Enter Rome at the time of the slave uprisings under Spartacus! The escaped rebels have managed to gain influence and power. Rome is attempting to undermine the stronger armies of the slaves in order to restore "pax", or peace – but only for personal gain.

Will the Empire collapse under the strain, or will their promises to insurgents succeed in drawing them to their side?

The players play the part of the escaped slaves who try to increase their sphere of influence and undermine the Roman establishment. Using their cards, they expand their power in seven different categories. At the end of the game, each player tries to be stronger than Rome - and, of course, stronger than any opponent. Through intrigue, however, a player can join forces with Rome and thus contribute to its victory over the slave revolt.

PAX is a multi-faceted game of card management and influence in which each card requires a tricky tactical decision. With two copies of the game, up to eight players can compete for a foothold in the Roman Empire.

item.description:
Alberta-opoly was created with the help of Albertans.

Alberta-Opoly hits the highlights with some of the province’s most interesting landmarks. Full of buffalo, crops, and parks, this game is truly about Alberta. So choose your token and roll the dice.
You may be the new owner of Dinosaur Provincial Park or meet aliens at the province’s UFO landing pad.

item.description:
Take part in a favorite holiday tradition with the Parade-opoly board game.

Just roll the dice and march your way through Columbus Circle and down to 34th and Broadway with all the famous floats and balloons of Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description:
Pond Hockey-Opoly is a game that brings back the memories of frozen feet, runny noses, fresh air and the way hockey is meant to be played.

It has all the action of a traditional property trading game... along with some nifty stick-handling fun! Buy your favorite ponds and rinks, then collect «warm-up shacks» and trade them in for «arenas». As you play, turn over the deeds to learn interesting facts about each pond or rink.

A new game of Storm over series. This time, the game covers the whole Pacific war from Pearl Harbor to the end of war. One year is covered with 3 game turns. The map covers from West coast to Bombay. The game engine is an advanced storm over system in which you can build your own card hands by selecting cards. Though the game covers naval actions and air combat, the most important thing is occupying the territory by Army. The victory is determined by Victory points which mainly come from the important land areas.

This "Scene It?" variant is based on the Christian children's radio show "Adventures in Odyssey." Players take turns rolling a die and moving their character around a game board. There are five different kinds of trivia categories that can be landed on, including two that utilize a DVD player. First person to get to the end of the board wins. The DVD also features a boardless "Lightning Play" mode said to be best for fast play or a party situation.
